About

Professional portfolio of Dr. Rangeel Singh Raina, MBBS, M.D. (Pharmacology), Principal and Professor at Government Medical College, Haridwar, specializing in Pharmacology, Patient Safety, and Drug Information. Member of Executive Council of National Association of Pharmacology and Therapeutics.

Dr. Raina is an accomplished Principal and Professor (Pharmacology) at Government Medical College, Haridwar. He serves on the Executive Council of the National Association of Pharmacology and Therapeutics and is a member of the Governing Body of State Medical Council, Uttarakhand. His expertise spans Pharmacology, Patient Safety, and Clinical Pharmacy.

As the Founder Coordinator of the Adverse Drug Monitoring Centre at GDMC Dehradun and Founder Member Secretary of Institutional Ethics Committees, Dr. Raina has made significant contributions to medical education and research. He was recognized as the Best Teacher at Government Doon Medical College, Dehradun in 2017.

Teaching & Mentorship

Dr. Raina with MBBS students at Government Medical College, Haridwar

Dedication to Medical Education

With a passion for developing the next generation of medical professionals, Dr. Raina has dedicated a significant portion of his career to teaching and mentoring students. His innovative teaching methodologies have helped countless students master the complexities of pharmacology and develop critical thinking skills essential for medical practice.

Teaching Philosophy

Dr. Raina believes in creating an interactive and supportive learning environment that encourages students to think critically about pharmacological concepts and their clinical applications. His teaching approach combines theoretical knowledge with practical case studies, ensuring students develop a comprehensive understanding of drug actions, interactions, and clinical applications.

Best Teacher Award (2017)

Recognized for excellence in teaching at Government Doon Medical College, Dehradun

  • Rational Use of Medicines

MBBS Teaching

Comprehensive pharmacology curriculum for undergraduate medical students

Regular workshops on Pharmacovigilance and ADR reporting

Staff Training

Training programs for nursing and paramedical staff on drug interactions

Expertise

Rational Use of Medicines

Research and application of evidence-based medicine practices to optimize drug therapy.

Clinical Pharmacy

Advancing patient care through pharmaceutical knowledge and intervention strategies.

Drug Information

Development of comprehensive drug information resources for healthcare professionals.

Patient Safety

Implementation of protocols and systems to reduce medication errors and improve outcomes.

Pharmacovigilance

Monitoring, detection, and prevention of adverse effects associated with pharmaceutical products.

Medical Education

Teaching and training of medical students in pharmacology and related fields.
